thread.title: Sooners only have to look at 2013 to know what a struggling Texas team is capable of
thread.title_full: Sooners only have to look at 2013 to know what a struggling Texas team is capable of | Dallas Morning News

author: Kate Hairopoulos
title: Sooners only have to look at 2013 to know what a struggling Texas team is capable of
text:
NORMAN, Okla. -- The Oklahoma Sooners, ranked No. 10 nationally and 4-0, know that they are favored to beat 1-4 Texas, their floundering, Twitter-sniping rival to the south on Saturday.
But lest they become overconfident, they are using 2013 as a reminder that the expected doesn't always play out at the Cotton Bowl.
UT entered that season's Red River game at 3-2, having just survived at Iowa State. OU strutted into Fair Park, undefeated at 5-0, including a win over Notre Dame, and a two-touchdown favorite.
Texas won 36-20.
"We thought we were going to beat them because they were having a down beginning, just like they are this year," OU junior linebacker Jordan Evans said this week. "They proved us wrong."
So about UT's 50-7 loss last week at TCU ...
"The team we get at the Cotton Bowl is going to be completely different," OU senior center Ty Darlington said. "It's going to be a dog fight."
OU coach Bob Stoops also brought up the 2013 loss. And he also made sure to mention that Texas' four losses this season have come against opponents that are a combined 19-1.
"They've probably played the toughest schedule as anybody in the country to this point," Stoops said. "I know coach [Charlie] Strong and his staff do an excellent job."
